    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void connectionStatusEvent(java.lang.Boolean isConnected)
      EventBus callback fired after receiving the connection status If the user is connected then we might pass to the first step of the synchronisation process which is selecting local saved trips If the user is not connected then just show a Toast
      void onCitiesFailure(java.lang.Throwable t)
      Interface callback in case that our HTTP request to get German cities list failed for any reason As the task suggest that we might save offline the trip information, it might happens that the user is offline while filling this form, therefore I provided a second German cities list source which is a local JSON file
      void onCitiesResponse(retrofit2.Response<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>> response)
      Interface callback in case that our HTTP request to get German cities succeed (status code) Also need to make sure that the response body is not null and the array is not empty else fetch the data from the local JSON file
      void onInsertCloudTripFailure()
      Interface callback in case our operation to insert the trip into cloud failed Therefore show a Toast as indication
      void onInsertCloudTripResponse()
      Interface callback in case our operation to insert the trip into cloud succeed Therefore show a Toast as indication
      void onInsertTripFailure()
      Interface callback in case our Room operation to insert a trip failed Therefore show a Toast as an indication
      void onInsertTripResponse()
      Interface callback in case our Room operation to insert a trip succeed Therefore show a Toast as an indication
      void onSelectLocalTrips(java.util.List<Trip> localTrips)
      Interface callback fired after selecting local trips the one saved in SQLight If the size of the saved local trips equal 1 that means that we might select data from the cloud and compare the difference for possible synchronisation.
      void onSelectRemoteTrips(java.util.List<MockedCloudTrip> cloudTrips)
      Interface callback fired after selecting remote trips (supposedly from the cloud).
      void saveTripData()
      This method will be called once the user click save the trip button Therefore check if the form is valid and call the required Room method to insert this trip in SQLite Results from this SQLite operation will be fired on onInsertTripResponse and onInsertTripFailure

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • saveTripData

        public void saveTripData()
        This method will be called once the user click save the trip button Therefore check if the form is valid and call the required Room method to insert this trip in SQLite Results from this SQLite operation will be fired on onInsertTripResponse and onInsertTripFailure

      • onCitiesResponse

        public void onCitiesResponse(retrofit2.Response<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>> response)
        Interface callback in case that our HTTP request to get German cities succeed (status code) Also need to make sure that the response body is not null and the array is not empty else fetch the data from the local JSON file
        Specified by:
        onCitiesResponse in interface CitiesLogic.CitiesInterface
        Parameters:
        response -

      • onCitiesFailure

        public void onCitiesFailure(java.lang.Throwable t)
        Interface callback in case that our HTTP request to get German cities list failed for any reason As the task suggest that we might save offline the trip information, it might happens that the user is offline while filling this form, therefore I provided a second German cities list source which is a local JSON file
        Specified by:
        onCitiesFailure in interface CitiesLogic.CitiesInterface
        Parameters:
        t -

      • onInsertTripResponse

        public void onInsertTripResponse()
        Interface callback in case our Room operation to insert a trip succeed Therefore show a Toast as an indication
        Specified by:
        onInsertTripResponse in interface TripLogic.TripInterface

      • onInsertTripFailure

        public void onInsertTripFailure()
        Interface callback in case our Room operation to insert a trip failed Therefore show a Toast as an indication
        Specified by:
        onInsertTripFailure in interface TripLogic.TripInterface

      • onSelectLocalTrips

        public void onSelectLocalTrips(java.util.List<Trip> localTrips)
        Interface callback fired after selecting local trips the one saved in SQLight If the size of the saved local trips equal 1 that means that we might select data from the cloud and compare the difference for possible synchronisation. If the size of the saved local trips equal 0 abort and no need to synchronise. If the size of saved local trips > 1 do nothing, this should not be possible.
        Specified by:
        onSelectLocalTrips in interface TripLogic.TripInterface
        Parameters:
        localTrips -

      • onSelectRemoteTrips

        public void onSelectRemoteTrips(java.util.List<MockedCloudTrip> cloudTrips)
        Interface callback fired after selecting remote trips (supposedly from the cloud). If the number of remote trips equal 0 that means the cloud have no information about our local saved trips therefore push our saved local trip into the cloud. Else if the number of remote trips is more or equal than 1 then we will need to check if our local trip has been synchronised before or no.
        Specified by:
        onSelectRemoteTrips in interface TripLogic.TripInterface
        Parameters:
        cloudTrips -

      • onInsertCloudTripResponse

        public void onInsertCloudTripResponse()
        Interface callback in case our operation to insert the trip into cloud succeed Therefore show a Toast as indication
        Specified by:
        onInsertCloudTripResponse in interface TripLogic.TripInterface

      • onInsertCloudTripFailure

        public void onInsertCloudTripFailure()
        Interface callback in case our operation to insert the trip into cloud failed Therefore show a Toast as indication
        Specified by:
        onInsertCloudTripFailure in interface TripLogic.TripInterface

      • connectionStatusEvent

        @Subscribe(threadMode=MAIN)
public void connectionStatusEvent(java.lang.Boolean isConnected)
        EventBus callback fired after receiving the connection status If the user is connected then we might pass to the first step of the synchronisation process which is selecting local saved trips If the user is not connected then just show a Toast
        Parameters:
        isConnected -
